content.user_title: Remove AI writing patterns from prose
content.value_statement: AI-generated text often contains predictable patterns that reduce authenticity. This skill identifies and eliminates common AI tells like filler phrases, formulaic structures, and emphasis crutches. Use it to make AI-assisted writing sound more natural and human.
actual_capabilities: Identifies throat-clearing openers like "Here's the thing" and "It turns out"
Flags emphasis crutches such as "Full stop" and "Let that sink in"
Detects binary contrast structures like "Not because X. Because Y"
Catches dramatic fragmentation for manufactured profundity
Reviews rhythm patterns including three-item lists and punchy endings
Scores writing on directness, rhythm, trust, authenticity, and density
limitations: Does not edit text automatically - provides guidance for manual revision
Focused on English prose patterns only
Requires human judgment for nuanced stylistic decisions

use_cases.title: Edit AI-assisted drafts
use_cases.description: Review AI-generated first drafts to remove predictable patterns before publication.

use_cases.title: Quick style check
use_cases.description: Run through documents to identify formulaic AI tells before detailed editing.

use_cases.title: Improve documentation
use_cases.description: Apply to technical writing to ensure documentation sounds natural and direct.

prompt_templates.title: Quick check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this paragraph for AI writing patterns using Stop Slop rules. Report any throat-clearing openers, emphasis crutches, or formulaic structures found.

prompt_templates.title: Full review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this document using Stop Slop scoring. Rate 1-10 on directness, rhythm, trust, authenticity, and density. List specific patterns to revise.

prompt_templates.title: Before publish
prompt_templates.prompt: Before publishing, run Stop Slop quick checks: three consecutive sentences same length, paragraphs ending with one-liners, em-dashes before reveals, metaphors being explained.

prompt_templates.title: Rewrite guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this AI-generated text to remove Stop Slop patterns: cut all throat-clearing openers, break binary contrasts, vary sentence lengths, remove filler adverbs, trust readers with direct statements.

output_examples.input: Here's the thing: building products is hard. Not because the technology is complex. Because people are complex. Let that sink in.
output: ⚠️ Binary contrast structure: "Not because X. Because Y" pattern
⚠️ Emphasis crutch detected: "Let that sink in"
Rewrite: "Building products is hard. Technology is manageable. People aren't."

best_practices: Apply the skill early in the editing process before fine-tuning details
Use the scoring rubric consistently across documents for measurable improvement
Focus on removing patterns that feel performative rather than substantive
anti_patterns: Do not use for technical documentation that genuinely requires careful setup
Do not apply mechanically - some rhetorical patterns serve legitimate purposes
Do not over-edit to the point of losing the original message or voice

faq.question: What does "Stop Slop" mean?
faq.answer: Slop refers to low-quality, formulaic AI output. Stop Slop helps eliminate these predictable patterns.

faq.question: Does this edit text automatically?
faq.answer: No. It identifies patterns and provides guidance. You apply the changes manually.

faq.question: What is the scoring system?
faq.answer: Rate 1-10 on five dimensions: directness, rhythm, trust, authenticity, and density. Below 35/50 means revision needed.

faq.question: Can I use this for any writing?
faq.answer: Best suited for prose and content writing. Some patterns may serve legitimate purposes in technical or creative contexts.

faq.question: How long does a review take?
faq.answer: Quick checks take seconds. Full document review with scoring takes a few minutes depending on length.

faq.question: Is this for AI detection?
faq.answer: No. It improves AI-assisted writing to sound more natural, not to hide AI usage.
